abstract.text: A view that enables the user to scan their room with the device’s camera.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This class provides your app with a view that manages the scan process from start to finish, including:
A camera feed that users look through to see their room in AR.
Real-time graphic overlays that display on top of physical structures in the room to convey scanning progress.
User instructions that explain how to position the device, if the framework requires a specific kind of device movement or perspective to complete the capture.
When the app determines that the current scan is complete, the view displays a small-scale version of the scanned room for the user to approve.
Alternatively, your app can display custom graphics during the scanning process by creating and using a scan session object (
for a sample code project that demonstrates

abstract.text: Create a 3D model of a room by interactively guiding people to scan their physical environment using a device’s camera.
An object that manages the room-scanning process.
A view that enables the user to scan their room with the device’s camera.
An object that notifies a delegate of particular events in the room-scanning life cycle.
An object that determines whether to post-process the results of a scan.
Serializes the view to the specified coder.
Creates a view by deserializing from the specified coder.
Creates a view that sizes to the specified frame.
Creates a room-capture view with the given AR session.
A Boolean value that determines whether the view displays a miniature rendering of the scanned room at the bottom of its bounds.
Instructs the view’s subviews to position within the view.
An array that contains the view’s subviews.
Notifies the view when the device orientation changes.
A specification to post-process the results of a scan.
Create an AR experience that enables people to scan a building that contains multiple rooms.

doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/R.title: Scanning the rooms of a single structure

abstract.text: An object that manages the content for a rectangular area on the screen.
Methods your app can implement to respond to layer-related events.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
Methods that associate a unique identifier with elements in your user interface.
An interface that provides a source for shareable content to fulfill user requests to share current content.
A collection of methods that gives you access to the appearance proxy for a class.
A protocol that a class must adopt to allow appearance customization using the [`UIAppearance`](doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAppearance) API.
A set of methods for converting between different frames of reference on a screen.
A set of methods that can make a custom object eligible to participate in UIKit Dynamics.
A set of methods that define the focus behavior for a branch of the view hierarchy.
An object that can become focused.
The container responsible for providing geometric context to focus items within a given focus environment.
Methods that provide details about how to display your custom content in the large content viewer.
The interface that determines whether a responder object supports paste configuration.
A type that can be an anchor for a popover presentation controller.
A set of standard methods that apps can adopt to support editing.
A set of methods that makes the iOS interface environment available to your app.
The protocol you adopt to restore an object’s state from a user activity.
A type that calls your code in reaction to changes in the trait environment.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
